alert.note: Alert for Forsyth (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 5:58PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Forsyth County through 700 PM EDT... At 557 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Pinnacle to near East Bend to Buck Shoals. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rainfall may also lead to localized flooding, especially in poor drainage locations. Locations impacted include... Winston-Salem, Clemmons, Bermuda Run, Huntsville, Lewisville, Walkertown, Rural Hall, Stanleyville, Pfafftown and Donnaha. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
